title: DSAN-5000: Introduction
text:
See the following link for more information about the author: about me
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

It is highly recommended that you build your website using .ipynb files and NOT .qmdfiles
Functionally the two formats are basically identical, i.e. they are just Markdown + Code
However there is ONE MAJOR DIFFERENCE, i.e. .ipynb stores the code outputs in the meta-data of the file

This means you ONLY HAVE TO RUN THE CODE ONCE with .ipynb
.qmd will run the code every time you build the website, which can be very slow

There are caching options for .qmd, however, they are “messier” that just using .ipynb

Note: .qmd is fine if there is no code, in which case it is basically just a Markdown file

Converting between the two

You can switch between the two formats using
quarto convert clustering.qmd this will output a .ipynb version called clustering.ipynb
quarto convert eda.ipynb this will output a .qmd version called eda.qmd

YOU CAN RUN R CODE IN VSC WITH .ipynb, see the following link

https://saturncloud.io/blog/how-to-use-jupyter-r-kernel-with-visual-studio-code/

It is possible, but NOT RECOMMENDED, to mix Python and R code in the same file

IMPORTANT ASIDE

A .ipynb file is simply a JSON file with a specialized structural format
You can see this by running more eda/eda.ipynb from the command line
Which will output the following;


TIP FOR MAC USERS

command+control+shift+4 is very useful on a mac.

It takes a screenshot and saves it to the clip-board

The following VSC extension allows you to paste images from the clip-board with alt+command+v.

tab is your best friend when using the command line, since it does auto-completion
open ./path_to_file will open any file or directory from the command line

title: Data Exploration
text: Build out your website tab for exploratory data analysis

title: Data Exploration
text:
Quick look at the data

# Import seaborn
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Apply the default theme
sns.set_theme(style="whitegrid", palette="pastel")

# Load an example dataset
tips = sns.load_dataset("tips")
print(tips)

     total_bill   tip     sex smoker   day    time  size
0         16.99  1.01  Female     No   Sun  Dinner     2
1         10.34  1.66    Male     No   Sun  Dinner     3
2         21.01  3.50    Male     No   Sun  Dinner     3
3         23.68  3.31    Male     No   Sun  Dinner     2
4         24.59  3.61  Female     No   Sun  Dinner     4
..          ...   ...     ...    ...   ...     ...   ...
239       29.03  5.92    Male     No   Sat  Dinner     3
240       27.18  2.00  Female    Yes   Sat  Dinner     2
241       22.67  2.00    Male    Yes   Sat  Dinner     2
242       17.82  1.75    Male     No   Sat  Dinner     2
243       18.78  3.00  Female     No  Thur  Dinner     2

[244 rows x 7 columns]

title: Data Exploration
text:
Basic visualization


# Create a visualization
sns.relplot(
    data=tips,
    x="total_bill", y="tip", col="time",
    hue="smoker", style="smoker", size="size",
)

plt.show()

title: Data Exploration
text:
Quick look at the data

# Import seaborn
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Apply the default theme
sns.set_theme(style="whitegrid", palette="pastel")

# Load an example dataset
tips = sns.load_dataset("tips")
print(tips)

     total_bill   tip     sex smoker   day    time  size
0         16.99  1.01  Female     No   Sun  Dinner     2
1         10.34  1.66    Male     No   Sun  Dinner     3
2         21.01  3.50    Male     No   Sun  Dinner     3
3         23.68  3.31    Male     No   Sun  Dinner     2
4         24.59  3.61  Female     No   Sun  Dinner     4
..          ...   ...     ...    ...   ...     ...   ...
239       29.03  5.92    Male     No   Sat  Dinner     3
240       27.18  2.00  Female    Yes   Sat  Dinner     2
241       22.67  2.00    Male    Yes   Sat  Dinner     2
242       17.82  1.75    Male     No   Sat  Dinner     2
243       18.78  3.00  Female     No  Thur  Dinner     2

[244 rows x 7 columns]

title: Data Exploration
text:
Basic visualization


# Create a visualization
sns.relplot(
    data=tips,
    x="total_bill", y="tip", col="time",
    hue="smoker", style="smoker", size="size",
)

plt.show()

title: About Me: Erin Bevec
text:
Born in Malvern, Pennsylvania, Erin attended Great Valley High School and played competitive softball. Earning an Army Reserve Officers’ Training Corps Scholarship upon graduation, Erin attended the University of Rochester in upstate New York where she pursued two degrees in Statistics and Epidemiology. Erin held membership in Army ROTC and the University of Rochester Varsity Softball team during undergrad. She also participated in undergraduate research. After graduating from undergrad, Erin moved to the District of Columbia. She works full time as a data science consultant, part time as a Second Lieutenant in the United States Army Reserve, and simultanoeusly attends Georgetown University in pursuit of an M.S. in Data Science & Analytics.













University of Rochester
University of Rochester
Georgetown University





B.S. Statistics
B.A. Epidemiology
M.S. Data Science & Analytics





May 2023
May 2023
Anticipated: May 2025




 











Envision2bWell
Tethra Technologies
Merck & Co. 
Jensen Hughes





Content Writer Intern
Machine Learning/Software Engineering Intern
Global Data Operations Intern
Machine Learning Intern








Conducted sexual and reproductive health research including a mixed-methods survey analysis and the optimization of methodological practice in SRH.



Conducted bioninformatics research in the fields of immnology and virology. Focused on survey and genomics data derived from a cohort study on atopic disease in distinct populations.






Leading soliders in preparation to defend against Chemical, Biological, Radiological, and Nuclear threats.



Providing data science consulting to clients in the nuclear power space. Leveraging natural language processing and artificial intellegence to predict real-time functional risk at nuclear power plants to ensure safe operations.















Sentiment Analysis
Bayesian Inference
Markov Processes
Decision Theory
Formal Logic





National Security
Market Research
Geopolitics









(Richards 2022)
(Levandowski et al. 2023)
(Järvinen et al. 2022)





Erin is an avid hiker and rockclimber. Her outdoor expeditions have spanned the continental United States. She is actively pursuing a lifetime goal of visiting every National Park in the United States. So far, she has visited \(\frac{8}{63}\) parks:



Rocky Mountain National Park
Mount Rainier National Park
Olympic National Park
Zion National Park



Bryce Canyon National Park
Canyonlands National Park
Captiol Reef National park
Arches National Park



Erin has been powerlifting since 2016. She hopes to compete in a powerlifting competiton in the DC area this coming Spring.
